seccommerce.secsignersigg
Class SecSigner

java.lang.Object
  seccommerce.secsignersigg.SecSigner

public class SecSigner
extends java.lang.Object

SecSigner container class for signature and verification calls.

The interaction component provides the external interface of SecSigner to signature applications. The interaction component is an API which encapsulates the security functions against the calling application.

The operation of the signature- and verification process cannot be influenced externally. The result is returned to the calling application only after completion of the process or when the user cancels the process.

SecSigner implements two main processes: create a digital signature and verify a digital signature.

  1. (optional) Invoke the init process: 
          SecSigner secSigner = new SecSigner(...);
      secSigner.initSignUnits(...);
  2. Invoke the sign process: 
          SecSigner secSigner = new SecSigner(...);

      SignatureRecord signatureRecord = new SignatureRecord();
      signatureRecord.setDocument();
      signatureRecord.setDocumentFileName();
      signatureRecord.setDocumentUrl();
      signatureRecord...

      secSigner.sign(...)

      secSigner.close();
  3. Invoke the verify process: 
          SecSigner secSigner = new SecSigner(...);

      SignatureRecord signatureRecord = new SignatureRecord();
      signatureRecord.setDocument();
      signatureRecord.setDocumentFileName();
      signatureRecord.setDocumentUrl();
      signatureRecord...

      SecSignerVerifyResult secSignerVerifyResult = secSigner.verify(...)

      secSignerVerifyResult.getResult(); // gets the result code

      secSigner.close();
    Result codes include but are not limited too: 
          SecSignerConstants.SECSIGNER_VERIFY_SIGNATUREVALID
      SecSignerConstants.SECSIGNER_VERIFY_SIGNATUREINVALID
This class contains methods which are the entry points to SecSigner TOE (target of evaluation) as specified in the Common Criteria (CC 3.1) evaluation of SecSigner. Other methods are not covered by the CC evaluation. The latter methods carry an appropriate note in their comment.

Version:
$Id: SecSigner.java,v 1.65 2015/05/22 15:06:08 titus Exp $
Author:
SecCommerce Informationssysteme GmbH, Hamburg

Constructor Detail

SecSigner

public SecSigner(javax.swing.JApplet applet)
          throws SecSignerException
Creates a SecSigner for use in an applet or in a web start application.

Parameters:
applet - the parent applet or null if called from a web start application
Throws:
SecSignerException - if the properties file could not be read or the self-check-signature is invalid or not signed by an authorized SecCommerce employee or the Java version is too old or the SecSigner JAR cannot be loaded or no resource bundle was found for the specified region or the properties file was not found in the resource or no OID resource bundle was found in the SecSigner JAR or if there is a SecSigner instance already.

SecSigner

public SecSigner(java.awt.Window parentWindow,
                 java.util.Properties properties)
          throws SecSignerException
Creates a SecSigner for use in a pop-up window belonging to an application. SecSigner's files will be searched in the current working directory.

Parameters:
parentWindow - the parent window, if null then it has to be supplied in each following call to sign(), decrypt and so on
properties - user editable properties.
Throws:
SecSignerException - if the properties file could not be read or the self-check-signature is invalid or not signed by an authorized SecCommerce employee or the Java version is too old or the SecSigner JAR cannot be loaded or no resource bundle was found for the specified region or the properties file was not found in the resource or no OID resource bundle was found in the SecSigner JAR or if there is a SecSigner instance already.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the properties parameter or the window parameter is null.

                                     throws SecSignerException
Returns true if a smart card is inserted in any card reader.

Returns:
true if any card is available.
Throws:

sign

public final void sign(SignatureRecord[] signatureRecords,
                       byte[][] cipherCert,
                       byte[][] attributeCert,
                       SoftKey signatureSoftKey,
                       boolean modal)
                throws SecSignerException
Deprecated. use sign(SignatureRecord[], byte[][], byte[], byte[], byte[][], boolean) instead

Invokes the signing process of the SecSigner-GUI. Signs the specified array of documents.

Parameters:
signatureRecords - the documents to be signed and document specific parameters.
cipherCert - if set then the signatures will be encrypted for these certificates.
attributeCert - attribute certificates that will be added to the signatures if the regarding corresponding signature certificate is used.
signatureSoftKey - an encrypted software signature key to be used instead of smart cards.
modal - if true the SecSigner dialog blocks input to other windows of the same application when shown.
Throws:
SecSignerException - attribute certificate cannot be parsed or does not match the signature certificate of any inserted smart card or the number of documents exceeds the configured maximum or more than one document shall be signed, but the mass signature option is not licenced or the signature format type ID of the first document is unknown or the user canceled the signature process.
See Also:
SignatureRecord

sign

public final void sign(SignatureRecord[] signatureRecords,
                       byte[][] cipherCert,
                       byte[] signatureKey,
                       byte[] signatureCert,
                       byte[][] attributeCert,
                       boolean modal)
                throws SecSignerException
Invokes the signing process of the SecSigner-GUI. Signs the specified array of documents.

Parameters:
signatureRecords - the documents to be signed and document specific parameters.
cipherCert - if set then the signatures will be encrypted for these certificates.
signatureKey - an encrypted software signature key to be used instead of smart cards.
signatureCert - a DER encoded signature certificate to be used corresponding to the smartcard or software key.
attributeCert - attribute certificates that will be added to the signatures if the regarding corresponding signature certificate is used.
modal - if true the SecSigner dialog blocks input to other windows of the same application when shown.
Throws:
SecSignerException - attribute certificate cannot be parsed or does not match the signature certificate of any inserted smart card or the number of documents exceeds the configured maximum or more than one document shall be signed, but the mass signature option is not licenced or the signature format type ID of the first document is unknown or the user canceled the signature process.
See Also:
SignatureRecord

attributeCert - attribute certificates that will be added to the signatures if the regarding corresponding signature certificate is used.
modal - if true the SecSigner dialog blocks input to other windows of the same application when shown.
alwaysOnTop - if true the SecSigner dialog will always be on top of all other windows.
Throws:
SecSignerException - attribute certificate cannot be parsed or does not match the signature certificate of any inserted smart card or the number of documents exceeds the configured maximum or more than one document shall be signed, but the mass signature option is not licenced or the signature format type ID of the first document is unknown or the user canceled the signature process.

verify

public final SecSignerVerifyResult verify(SignatureRecord[] signatureRecords,
                                          byte[][] externSignersCertsDer,
                                          boolean allowSig,
                                          boolean offerFileOpenDlg,
                                          boolean ocspMandatory,
                                          boolean modal)
                                   throws SecSignerException
Invokes the signature verification process of the SecSigner-GUI. Verifies the specified array of signatures.

Parameters:
signatureRecords - container array for documents, their signatures, timestamps, etc.
externSignersCertsDer - array of certificates which include the certificate of the signer. Required if the signatures do not contain the signing certificates.
allowSig - if false then the user cannot sign the verified document.
offerFileOpenDlg - if true offer a file-open-dialog if data are missing, else return an error then.
ocspMandatory - automatically send OCSP request if true.
modal - if true the SecSigner dialog blocks input to other windows of the same application when shown.
Returns:
information about the verification result.
Throws:
SecSignerException - if the user canceled the verification process.

encryptDataOnly

public final byte[] encryptDataOnly(byte[] data,
                                    byte[][] cipherCert)
                             throws SecSignerException
Encrypts data for the owners of the specified certificates. This method is not part of the target of evaluation of SecSigner in the Common Criteria evaluation.

Parameters:
data - plain data to be encrypted.
cipherCert - certificates to encrypt for.
Returns:
encrypted PKCS#7 EnvelopedData object.
Throws:
SecSignerException - if no data or no certificates were provided and no data file or no certificate file could be opened or a supplied certificate could not be parsed or the EnvelopedData could not be constructed.

                                  byte[][] cipherCert)
                           throws SecSignerException

Parameters:

cipherCert - the certificates to encrypt for
Throws:

saveEncryptCertificate

public final void saveEncryptCertificate()
                                  throws SecSignerException
Saves the encryption certificate of the first smart card into a file. This method is not part of the target of evaluation of SecSigner in the Common Criteria evaluation.

Throws:
SecSignerException - if the certificate cannot be read from the smart card

setCollectRandom

public final void setCollectRandom(boolean collectRandom)
                            throws SecSignerException
Decides whether random bytes shall be collected from an inserted smart card upon insertion in order to initializes a pseudo random number generator (PRNG). Subsequently the PRNG will be available for encryption of data. This method is not part of the target of evaluation of SecSigner in the Common Criteria evaluation.

Parameters:
collectRandom - if true then random numbers will be collected.
Throws:
SecSignerException - if the SecSigner has been closed already

nextRandomBytes

public final void nextRandomBytes(byte[] a)
                           throws SecSignerException
Gets random bytes. This method is not part of the target of evaluation of SecSigner in the Common Criteria evaluation.

Parameters:
a - array to be filled with random bytes.
Throws:
SecSignerException - if no pseudo random number generator was initialized yet because no random numbers from a smart card have been read yet.

getExtOptions

public final SecSignerExtOptions getExtOptions()
                                        throws SecSignerException
Gets the options of SecSigner, which are available for external applications.

Returns:
the public options for external applications
Throws:
SecSignerException - if the options cannot be retrieved

signWithAuthKey

public final byte[] signWithAuthKey(byte[] hash)
                             throws SecSignerException
Sign with the authentication key of the smart card inserted into the first card reader. Please confirm with sales@seccommerce.com that the usage of this method is included in your license. SecCommerce offers several products for authentication including SecRouter, SecAuthenticator and SecSign ID which may better suit your purpose. This method is not part of the target of evaluation of SecSigner in the Common Criteria evaluation.

Parameters:
hash - hash to be signed.
Returns:
raw signature, for example RSA, no PKCS#7 SignedData.
Throws:
SecSignerException - sign error.

getSigningCert

public final byte[] getSigningCert()
                            throws SecSignerException
Gets the signature certificate of the smart card inserted into the first card reader.

Returns:
signature certificate of the smart card inserted into the first card reader.
Throws:
SecSignerException - if no card reader or no smart card is available or the certificate has not been read yet.

                            throws SecSignerException
Adds an attribute certificate to the attribute certificate vector.

Parameters:

Throws:
SecSignerException - if the attribute certificate cannot be parsed or does not match the signature certificate of any inserted smart card.

changePin

public final void changePin(boolean modal)
                     throws SecSignerException
Opens a dialog that allows a change of PIN via key board or card reader for each PIN on the inserted smart card. This method is not part of the target of evaluation of SecSigner in the Common Criteria evaluation.

Parameters:
modal - if true the SecSigner dialog blocks input to other windows of the same application when shown.
Throws:
SecSignerException - if the user canceled the initialization process.

changeTransPin

public final void changeTransPin(boolean modal)
                          throws SecSignerException
Opens dialog that allows the setting of a PIN using the given transport PIN via key board or card reader for each PIN on the inserted smart card, or the setting of a PIN for T-TeleSec cards via key board. This method is not part of the target of evaluation of SecSigner in the Common Criteria evaluation.

Parameters:
modal - if true the SecSigner dialog blocks input to other windows of the same application when shown.
Throws:
SecSignerException - if the user canceled the initialization process.

getCardName

public final java.lang.String getCardName()
                                   throws SecSignerException
Gets the name of the signature card in the first card reader. 'Null' will be returned if that card has not yet been initialized. This method is not part of the target of evaluation of SecSigner in the Common Criteria evaluation.

Returns:
name of signature card in first card reader
Throws:
SecSignerException - if the SecSigner has been closed already

Returns:
number printed on the signature card in first card reader
Throws:
SecSignerException - if the SecSigner has been closed already

first card reader's name.
Throws:
SecSignerException - if the SecSigner has been closed already

getCardReaderFirmwareVersion

public final java.lang.String getCardReaderFirmwareVersion()
                                                    throws SecSignerException,
                                                           seccommerce.sec.SecExceptionCommunication
Gets the firmware version information available from the first card reader. 'Null' will be returned if that reader has not yet been initialized or no information is available. This method is not part of the target of evaluation of SecSigner in the Common Criteria evaluation.

Returns:
first card reader's firmware version information.
Throws:
seccommerce.sec.SecExceptionCommunication - if the card in the reader is not usable
SecSignerException - if the SecSigner has been closed already

getSignatureLimit

public final int getSignatureLimit()

Returns:
int signature limit per sign-call

Closes the SecSigner and the employed card readers.
